docs.summary: Manage Bookings checkout flow, calculate checkout options and integrate with payment related services.

params.name: paymentSelection
params.doc: Selected rate label (optional) to be used, and number of participants.

params.name: couponCode
params.doc: Coupon to apply to price calculations. An error will be thrown if given coupon is invalid.

params.name: contactId
params.doc: Member ID for which paid plans will be accessed.

docs.summary:
Calculates checkout options available to book and check out the given session/schedule.
> **Permissions**  
> This endpoint requires the Read Bookings - Public Data, Read Bookings - Including Participants or Manage Bookings permission scope.  
 To calculate the Wix Paid Plans available for a site member using the `contactId` field, the Manage Bookings permission scope is required.

extra.description: Returns the checkout options for a session. The response describes paid plans that can be used to pay for the booking.
Returns the checkout options for a session. The response describes an online payment is required.
Returns the checkout options for the given schedule id.

members.name: amount
members.doc: The required payment amount.

members.name: currency
members.doc: The currency in which the amount is quoted.

members.name: downPayAmount
members.doc: The amount of a down payment or deposit as part of the transaction.

members.name: orderId
members.doc: The order ID when the Pricing Plan was purchased.

members.name: benefitId
members.doc: The benefit ID.

members.name: planId
members.doc: The ID of the pricing plan.

members.name: id
members.doc: Checkout ID.

members.name: balance
members.doc: The final price, currency, down payment, and amount received.

members.name: paidPlanDetails
members.doc: Pricing plan details, if a pricing plan was used to pay for the booking.

members.name: couponDetails
members.doc: Coupon details, if a coupon was used to pay for the booking.

members.name: wixPayDetails
members.doc: Use wix_pay_multiple_details.

members.name: state
members.doc:
+ `COMPLETE` Amount paid in full.
 + `PENDING_CASHIER` An online payment is in progress and awaiting a response.
 + `REJECTED` The checkout request was rejected by the online payment process. 
 + `READY` All online checkout requirements were met. For example, when the service uses pay in person, or a partial or down payment was paid online.
 + `CANCELED`  Checkout cancelled.
 + `REFUNDED` When using Pricing Plans, if the booking was cancelled, it will be automatically refunded.
 + `PENDING_MERCHANT` An online payment was made, but the owner has not set up the necessary details.
 + `WIX_PAY_FAILURE` Online payment failure.
 + `PENDING_MARK_AS_PAID` Offline transaction. The transaction will be complete when explicitly marked as paid.
 + `PENDING_BUYER`  The transaction started, but is waiting for confirmation on the buyer's side. This can be due to credit or fraud checking on the provider's side, a long bank transfer, or similar processes.
 Checkout current state.

members.name: wixPayMultipleDetails
members.doc: In case of wix-pay service, holds all payment history for a booking.

members.name: finalPrice
members.doc:
The final calculated price.
 Calculated using the service's price, multiplied by the booking's number of participants, deducting any discounts or coupons.

members.name: amountReceived
members.doc: The current total amount paid.

members.name: couponName
members.doc: Coupon name.

members.name: couponCode
members.doc: Coupon Code.

members.name: couponDiscount
members.doc: Coupon discount amount.

members.name: couponId
members.doc: Coupon ID.

members.name: plan
members.doc: Plan details.

members.name: planName
members.doc: Plan name.

members.name: transactionId
members.doc: The transaction ID created in the Pricing Plans service when the member redeemed a benefit to pay for this booking.

members.name: txId
members.doc: Cashier transaction Id

members.name: orderId
members.doc: Cashier order Id

members.name: orderAmount
members.doc: The order amount we issued to Cashier.

members.name: orderStatus
members.doc:
+ `CREATED`  The transaction has been started.
 + `PENDING_MERCHANT` An online payment was made, but the owner has not set up the necessary details.
 + `COMPLETE`  The current part of the payment was completed.
 + `FAILED`  The Wix online payment system is unavailable or failed processing.
 + `DECLINED` The payment was declined.
 + `PENDING_MARK_AS_PAID` Offline transaction. The transaction will be complete when explicitly marked as paid.
 + `CANCELED` The transaction was cancelled.
 Transaction status

members.name: orderApprovalTime
members.doc: The date and time that the order was approved.

members.name: paymentVendorName
members.doc: Payment vendor name.

docs.summary:
Payment options for the service. Multiple payment options can be enabled. For example:
For a service to be paid only online using WiX, then set wix_pay_online=true and the rest should be set to false.
For a service to accept payment online via Wix or in person, set the wix_pay_online=true & wix_pay_in_person=true.

members.name: wixPayOnline
members.doc: Whether a booking made for the service can be paid online through Wix.

members.name: wixPayInPerson
members.doc: Whether a booking made for the service can be paid in person.

members.name: custom
members.doc: Whether a booking made for the service can be paid in a customized way, defined by the API.

members.name: wixPaidPlan
members.doc: Whether a booking made for the service can be paid using Wix Pricing Plans.

docs.summary: this message is as a result of the various checkout/update flows.

members.name: defaultPlan
members.doc: The plan that should be used for checkout by default. calculated according to internal heuristic.

members.name: plans
members.doc: Other plans available for checkout.

members.name: country

members.name: subdivision

members.name: postalCode

members.name: addressLine2
members.doc: Free text providing more detailed address info. Usually contains Apt, Suite, and Floor.

members.name: hint

members.name: geocode

members.name: subdivisions

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: Street name, number and apartment number.

members.name: addressLine
members.doc: Main address line, usually street and number, as free text.

members.name: code
members.doc: Subdivision code. Usually state, region, prefecture or province code, according to [ISO 3166-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-2).

members.name: name

members.name: number

members.name: longitude

members.name: lastName

members.name: email
members.doc: Contact email, used to create a new contact or get existing one from Contacts Service.

members.name: phone

members.name: address
members.doc: DEPRECATED. Contact address.

members.name: fullAddress

members.name: timeZone

members.name: countryCode
members.doc: Contact country in [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-2) format.

members.name: rateLabel
members.doc: The label corresponding to the booking rate. Default is free/custom.

members.name: numberOfParticipants
members.doc: The number of participants for this rate.

docs.summary:
Time periods that this location is open for business. Includes a collection of TimePeriod instances.
Aligned with https://developers.google.com/my-business/reference/rest/v4/accounts.locations#businesshours
With a few minor adjustments

members.name: periods
members.doc:
Times that this location is open. Each period represents a range of hours when the location is
open during the week. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: specialHourPeriod
members.doc: Exceptions to the business's regular hours.

docs.summary:
A span of time that the business is open,
starting on the specified open day/time and closing on the specified close day/time.
Closing time must occur after the opening time, for example later in the same day, or on a subsequent day.

members.name: openDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period starts on.

members.name: openTime
members.doc:
Time in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

members.name: closeDay
members.doc: Day of the week this period ends on.

members.name: closeTime
members.doc:
Time in 24hr ISO 8601 extended format (hh:mm). Valid values are 00:00-24:00, where 24:00 represents
midnight at the end of the specified day field.

docs.summary: Set of time periods when a location's operational hours differ from its normal business hours.

members.name: startDate
members.doc: Date and Time in 24hr iso-8601 Coordinated universal time (UTC)

members.name: endDate
members.doc: Date and Time in 24hr iso-8601 Coordinated universal time (UTC)

members.name: id
members.doc: The ID of the location

members.name: name
members.doc: Display name of the location

members.name: description
members.doc: Free text to better describe the location

members.name: default
members.doc:
Boolean that states the default location.
There can one default location per site, and changes on it affect on the Site Properties.
The default location can't be deleted and can be only marked through SetDefaultLocation api

members.name: status
members.doc: Status of the location. Active by default

members.name: locationType
members.doc: Type of the location

members.name: fax
members.doc: Fax number

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: Time zone

members.name: email
members.doc: Email address

members.name: phone
members.doc: Phone number

members.name: address
members.doc: Address

members.name: businessSchedule
members.doc:
Represents the time periods that this location is open for business. Holds a collection of TimePeriod instances.
TimePeriod indicates when the location is open. Each period represents a range of hours when the location is
open during the week. Limited to 100 time periods.

members.name: revision
members.doc: Location revision, represent the number of changes on the location

members.name: archived
members.doc:
Boolean that states if the location is archived.
Archived location can't be updated.

members.name: country
members.doc: country code

members.name: subdivision
members.doc: subdivision (usually state or region) code according to ISO 3166-2

members.name: city
members.doc: city name

members.name: postalCode
members.doc: zip/postal code

members.name: streetAddress
members.doc: A break down of the street to number and street name

members.name: formattedAddress
members.doc: A string containing the human-readable address of this location

members.name: hint
members.doc: Free text for human-to-human textual orientation aid purposes

members.name: geocode
members.doc: coordinates of the physical address

docs.summary: A break down of the street to number and street name

members.doc: street number

members.name: name
members.doc: street name

members.name: apt

docs.summary: Address Geolocation

members.name: latitude
members.doc: Latitude

members.name: longitude
members.doc: Longitude

members.name: locationType
members.doc:
+ `OWNER_BUSINESS` The business address as set in the site’s general settings.
 + `OWNER_CUSTOM` The address as set when creating the service.
 + `CUSTOM` The address set for the individual session.

members.name: address
members.doc: Free text address used when location_type is `OWNER_CUSTOM`.

members.name: customAddress
members.doc: Custom address, used when location_type is `"OWNER_CUSTOM"`.

messages.name: labeledPriceOptionsMapEntry
messages.displayName: labeled Price Options Map Entry Object

docs.summary: Set of key-value pairs.Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.

members.name: key:value
members.doc: `key` of type string, `value` of type object

members.name: labeledPriceOptions
members.doc: Set of key-value pairs.Mapping between a named price option, for example, adult or child prices, and the price, currency, and down payment amount.

members.name: priceText
members.doc: Textual price information used when **Price Per Session** is set to **Custom Price** in the app's service details page.

members.name: serviceId
members.doc: The ID of the booked service.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: The ID of the booked schedule.

members.name: title
members.doc: The session title at the time of booking.

members.name: location
members.doc: The location of the session.

members.name: rate
members.doc: The price options offered to book this session at the time of booking.

members.name: tags
members.doc: A list of tags for the booking.

members.name: onlineConference
members.doc: Online conference information.

members.name: singleSession
members.doc: Start and end time of the booked sessions.

members.name: setOfSessions
members.doc: First start and last end time of the booked sessions.

members.name: guestUrl
members.doc: Participant url.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Online conference provider identifier.

members.name: password
members.doc: Online conference password.

members.name: description
members.doc: Online conference description.

members.name: start
members.doc: The start time of the session.

members.name: end
members.doc: The end time of the session.

members.name: firstSessionStart
members.doc: The start time of the first session.

members.name: lastSessionEnd
members.doc: The end time of the last session.

members.name: id
members.doc: Participant ID.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Contact ID.

members.name: name
members.doc: Participant's name.

members.name: phone
members.doc: Participant's phone number.

members.name: email
members.doc: Participant's email address.

members.name: partySize
members.doc: Group or party size. The number of people attending. Defaults to 0. Maximum is 250.

members.name: approvalStatus
members.doc: Approval status for the participant. Generally the same status as the booking, unless updated using the `updateParticipant` API. Defaults to `"UNDEFINED"`.

members.name: inherited
members.doc: Whether the participant was inherited from the schedule, as opposed to being booked directly to the session.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID.

members.name: transparency
members.doc:
Sets a linked schedule's availability between the start and end of the session. Default is `"BUSY"`.
If set to `"BUSY"`, the schedule cannot have any available slots during the session. If set to `"FREE"`, the schedule can have available slots during the session.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID, of the linked schedule.

members.name: title
members.doc: Synced title of the external calendar event.

members.name: description
members.doc: Synced description of the external calendar event.

members.name: timestamp
members.doc:
Unix epoch time.
Required if `local_date_time` is not specified.
If `local_date_time` is specified, `timestamp` is calculated 
as `local_date_time` for the business's timezone in epoch format.

members.name: localDateTime
members.doc: An object containing the local date and time, with no time zone.

members.name: timeZone
members.doc: The time zone.

members.name: year
members.doc: Year. 4-digit format.

members.name: monthOfYear
members.doc: Month number, from 1-12.

members.name: dayOfMonth
members.doc: Day in the month, from 1-31.

members.name: hourOfDay
members.doc: Hour of the day, in 24-hour format, from 0-23.

members.name: minutesOfHour
members.doc: Minute, from 0-59.

members.name: id
members.doc: Wix Calendar conference ID.

members.name: externalId
members.doc: Conference meeting ID in the provider's conferencing system.

members.name: providerId
members.doc: Conference provider ID.

members.name: hostUrl
members.doc: URL used by the host to start the conference.

members.name: guestUrl
members.doc: URL used by a guest to join the conference.

members.name: password
members.doc: Password to join the conference.

members.name: description
members.doc: Conference description.

members.name: conferenceType
members.doc: Conference type.

members.name: accountOwnerId
members.doc: Account owner id in vc service

members.name: scheduleVersion
members.doc: Schedule version number, updated each time the schedule is updated.

members.name: sessionVersion
members.doc: Session version number, updated each time the session is updated.

members.name: id
members.doc: Session ID.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Schedule ID that the session belongs to.

members.name: scheduleOwnerId
members.doc: Owner ID of the schedule that the session belongs to.

members.name: originalStart
members.doc: Original start date and time of the session in Unix epoch time format.

members.name: start
members.doc:
An object specifying the start date and time of the session.
If the session is a recurring session, `start` must contain a local date/time.

members.name: end
members.doc:
An object specifying the end date and time of the session.
The `end` time must be after the `start` time and be same type as `start`.
If the session is a recurring session, `end` must contain a local date/time.

members.name: affectedSchedules
members.doc:
An object specifying a list of linked schedules and the way each schedule's availability is affected. A linked schedule is a schedule that has been associated with another schedule because there is a dependency between the two. This dependency affects the availability of both schedules. For example, the schedule of an instructor is linked to the schedule of the class that they instruct.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule but can still be overridden.

members.name: title
members.doc:
Session title. The default value is the schedule title.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: tags
members.doc:
Tags for the session. Optional. Defaults to the schedule's tags.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: location
members.doc:
An object describing the location where the session takes place.
Defaults to the schedule location.
For single sessions, `session.location.businessLocation` can only be provided for locations that are defined in the schedule using `schedule.location` or `schedule.availability.locations`.

members.name: capacity
members.doc:
Maximum number of participants that can be added to the session. Defaults to the schedule capacity.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: rate
members.doc:
The price options offered for the session.  Defaults to the schedule rate.
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: timeReservedAfter
members.doc:
Time reserved after the session end time, derived from the schedule availability constraints and the time between slots. Read-only.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: notes
members.doc:
Additional information about the session.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: totalNumberOfParticipants
members.doc:
The number of participants booked for the session. Read-only.
Calculated as the sum of the party sizes.

members.name: participants
members.doc:
List of participants booked for the session.
The list includes participants who have registered for this specific session, and participants who have registered for a schedule that includes this session.
If the session is a recurring session, this field must be empty.

members.name: inheritedFields
members.doc:
A list of properties for which values were inherited from the schedule.
This does not include participants that were inherited from the schedule.

members.name: externalCalendarOverrides
members.doc:
Title and description values to override session defaults when syncing to an external calendar.
Learn more about [syncing calendars](https://support.wix.com/en/article/wix-bookings-important-information-about-syncing-google-calendars-with-wix-bookings).
If the session is a recurring session, the value is inherited from the schedule and cannot be overridden.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Session status.
 Possible values are:
 `"CONFIRMED"`: Default value.
 `"CANCELLED"`: 
    * The session was generated from a recurring session and then deleted.
    * The session was created as a single session and then deleted.
    * The session is a recurring session and was deleted.

members.name: recurringIntervalId
members.doc:
Recurring interval ID. Defined when a session will be a recurring session. read-only. Optional.
For exmaple, when creating a class service  with recurring sessions, you add a recurrence rule to create recurring sessions.
This field is omitted for single sessions or instances of recurring sessions.
Specified when the session was originally generated from a schedule recurring interval.
Deprecated. Use `recurringSessionId`.

members.name: recurringSessionId
members.doc: Recurring session ID, if the session is a recurring session.

members.name: type
members.doc: Session type.

members.name: calendarConference
members.doc:
A conference created for the session according to the details set in the schedule's conference provider information.
If the session is a recurring session, this field is inherited from the schedule.

members.name: recurrence
members.doc:
A string representing a recurrence rule (RRULE) for a recurring session, as defined in [RFC5545](https://icalendar.org/iCalendar-RFC-5545/3-3-10-recurrence-rule.html). 
The RRULE defines a rule for repeating a session.
Supported parameters are:

|Keyword|Description|Supported values|
|--|--|---|
|`FREQ`|The frequency at which the session is recurs. Required.|`WEEKLY`|
|`INTERVAL`|How often, in terms of `FREQ`, the session recurs. Default is 1. Optional.|
|`UNTIL`|The UTC end date and time of the recurrence. Optional.|
|`BYDAY`|Days of the week when the event should recur. Required.|`MO`, `TU`, `WE`, `TH`, `FR`, `SA`, `SU`|


 For example, repeat every second week on a Monday until January 7, 2022 at 8 a.m.:
`FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=MO;UNTIL=20220107T080000Z`

 <!--ORIGINAL COMMENTS:
  `FREQ` — The frequency with which the session should be repeated (such as DAILY or WEEKLY).  
 Supported `WEEKLY` value is supported.
  INTERVAL — Works together with FREQ to specify how often the session should be repeated. For example, FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2 means once every two weeks. Optional. Default value is 1.
  COUNT — The number of times this event should be repeated. Not yet supported.
  UNTIL — The UTC date & time until which the session should be repeated. This parameter is optional. When it is not specified, the event repeats forever.
          The format is a short ISO date, followed by 'T' and a short time with seconds and without milliseconds, terminated by the UTC designator 'Z'. For example, until Jan. 19th 2018 at 7:00 AM: 'UNTIL=20180119T070000Z'.
  BYDAY - The days of the week when the event should be repeated. Currently, only a single day is supported. This parameter is mandatory.
       Possible values are: MO, TU, WE, TH, FR, SA, SU
       Note that DTSTART and DTEND lines are not allowed in this field; session start and end times are specified in the start and end fields.
       **Example**: FREQ=WEEKLY;INTERVAL=2;BYDAY=MO;UNTIL=20200427T070000Z
ORIGINAL COMMENTS-->

members.name: version
members.doc: An object containing the session and schedule versions.

members.name: forceInPersonCheckout
members.doc:
when defined as true, checkout the booking as "in-person" method.
 required BOOKINGS.MANAGE_PAYMENTS permission.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: member id for paid plans, may be valid only when identity is owner

members.name: flowControlSettings
members.doc: Sets the checkout flow behavior, some behaviors required permissions.

members.name: forceInPersonCheckout
members.doc:
when defined as true, charge the booking as "in-person" method.
 required BOOKINGS.MANAGE_PAYMENTS permission.

members.name: flowControlSettings
members.doc: Sets the charge flow behavior, some behaviors required permissions.

members.name: paymentSelection
members.doc: Selected rate label (optional) to be used, and number of participants.

members.name: couponCode
members.doc: Coupon to apply to price calculations. An error will be thrown if given coupon is invalid.

members.name: contactId
members.doc: Member ID for which paid plans will be accessed.

members.name: createSession
members.doc:
A session that will be created for this booking.
 schedule_id, schedule_owner_id, start, and rate are used to calculate the checkout options.
 Start is used to access the relevant paid plans.

members.name: sessionId
members.doc: Existing session ID.

members.name: scheduleId
members.doc: Existing schedule ID. Will be used to access service properties including payment options, rate, and first session start time that will be used to access relevant plans.

members.name: checkoutOptions
members.doc: Checkout options.

members.name: payments
members.doc: Transaction details.

members.name: paidPlans
members.doc: Paid plans available for checkout.

docs.summary:
Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • COMPLETE - Amount paid in full.
  • PENDING_CASHIER - An online payment is in progress and awaiting a response.
  • REJECTED - The checkout request was rejected by the online payment process.
  • READY - All online checkout requirements were met. For example, when the service uses pay in person, or a partial or down payment was paid online.
  • CANCELED - Checkout cancelled.
  • REFUNDED - When using Pricing Plans, if the booking was cancelled, it will be automatically refunded.
  • PENDING_MERCHANT - An online payment was made, but the owner has not set up the necessary details.
  • WIX_PAY_FAILURE - Online payment failure.
  • PENDING_MARK_AS_PAID - Offline transaction. The transaction will be complete when explicitly marked as paid.
  • PENDING_BUYER - The transaction started, but is waiting for confirmation on the buyer's side. This can be due to credit or fraud checking on the provider's side, a long bank transfer, or similar processes.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CREATED
  • PENDING_MERCHANT
  • COMPLETE - This part of the payment was completed.
  • FAILED - cashier is unavailable or failed processing
  • DECLINED
  • PENDING_MARK_AS_PAID
  • CANCELED

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • NEW_MESSAGE
  • UPDATE_MESSAGE

Enumerates the days of the week. Possible values are:
  • MONDAY
  • TUESDAY
  • WEDNESDAY
  • THURSDAY
  • FRIDAY
  • SATURDAY
  • SUNDAY

For future use Possible values are:
  • ACTIVE
  • IN_ACTIVE

For future use Possible values are:
  • UNKNOWN
  • BRANCH
  • OFFICES
  • RECEPTION
  • HEADQUARTERS

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • OWNER_BUSINESS
  • OWNER_CUSTOM
  • CUSTOM

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED - Default.
  • PENDING - Pending business approval.
  • APPROVED - Approved by the business.
  • DECLINED - Declined by the business.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • FREE - The schedule can have available slots during the session.
  • BUSY - The schedule cannot have available slots during the session. Default value.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • EVENT - The session creates an event on the calendar for the owner of the schedule that the session belongs to. Default type.
  • WORKING_HOURS - Deprecated. The session type is working hours. Represents intervals masked as working hours in the schedule owner's schedule.
  • TIME_AVAILABILITY - Deprecated
  • AVAILABILITY - The session represents a resource's available hours.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • ONLINE_MEETING_PROVIDER - API-generated online meeting.
  • CUSTOM - User-defined meeting.

Possible values are:
  • UNDEFINED
  • CONFIRMED - The session is confirmed. Default status.
  • CANCELLED - The session is cancelled. A cancelled session can be the cancellation of a recurring session that should no longer be displayed or a deleted single session. The ListSessions returns cancelled sessions only if 'includeDelete' flag is set to true.
